comment:
* Defines constants that are used as attribute keys in the * {@code AttributedCharacterIterator} returned * from {@code DateFormat.formatToCharacterIterator} and as * field identifiers in {@code FieldPosition}. *

* The class also provides two methods to map * between its constants and the corresponding Calendar constants. * * @since 1.4 * @see java.util.Calendar

variables.name: serialVersionUID
variables.comment: Proclaim serial compatibility with 1.4 FCS

variables.name: instanceMap
variables.comment: table of all instances in this class, used by readResolve

variables.name: calendarToFieldMapping
variables.comment: constant (such as Field.ERA).

variables.name: calendarField
variables.comment: Calendar field.

variables.name: ERA
variables.comment: * Constant identifying the era field.

variables.name: YEAR
variables.comment: * Constant identifying the year field.

variables.name: MONTH
variables.comment: * Constant identifying the month field.

variables.name: DAY_OF_MONTH
variables.comment: * Constant identifying the day of month field.

variables.name: HOUR_OF_DAY1
variables.comment:
* Constant identifying the hour of day field, where the legal values
         * are 1 to 24.

variables.name: HOUR_OF_DAY0
variables.comment:
* Constant identifying the hour of day field, where the legal values
         * are 0 to 23.

variables.name: MINUTE
variables.comment: * Constant identifying the minute field.

variables.name: SECOND
variables.comment: * Constant identifying the second field.

variables.name: MILLISECOND
variables.comment: * Constant identifying the millisecond field.

variables.name: DAY_OF_WEEK
variables.comment: * Constant identifying the day of week field.

variables.name: DAY_OF_YEAR
variables.comment: * Constant identifying the day of year field.

variables.name: DAY_OF_WEEK_IN_MONTH
variables.comment: * Constant identifying the day of week field.

variables.name: WEEK_OF_YEAR
variables.comment: * Constant identifying the week of year field.

variables.name: WEEK_OF_MONTH
variables.comment: * Constant identifying the week of month field.

variables.name: AM_PM
variables.comment:
* Constant identifying the time of day indicator
         * (e.g. "a.m." or "p.m.") field.

variables.name: HOUR1
variables.comment:
* Constant identifying the hour field, where the legal values are
         * 1 to 12.

variables.name: HOUR0
variables.comment:
* Constant identifying the hour field, where the legal values are
         * 0 to 11.

variables.name: TIME_ZONE
variables.comment: * Constant identifying the time zone field.

methods.name: public static Field ofCalendarField(int calendarField)
methods.comment:
* Returns the {@code Field} constant that corresponds to
         * the {@code Calendar} constant {@code calendarField}.
         * If there is no direct mapping between the {@code Calendar}
         * constant and a {@code Field}, null is returned.
         *
         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code calendarField} is
         *         not the value of a {@code Calendar} field constant.
         * @param calendarField Calendar field constant
         * @return Field instance representing calendarField.
         * @see java.util.Calendar

methods.name: public int getCalendarField()
methods.comment:
* Returns the {@code Calendar} field associated with this
         * attribute. For example, if this represents the hours field of
         * a {@code Calendar}, this would return
         * {@code Calendar.HOUR}. If there is no corresponding
         * {@code Calendar} constant, this will return -1.
         *
         * @return Calendar constant for this field
         * @see java.util.Calendar

methods.name: protected Object readResolve() throws InvalidObjectException
methods.comment:
* Resolves instances being deserialized to the predefined constants.
         *
         * @throws InvalidObjectException if the constant could not be
         *         resolved.
         * @return resolved DateFormat.Field constant
